column4: Can anyone think of a reason why my windows box can't reach my linux box, but my laptop can?
which is the linux box ip.
is there a vpn client on your windows side that is getting exclusive control on your network interface?
I'd be looking at things like, is the patch cable the same, can I contact it from the windows box booted onto an Ubuntu live cd, hardware testing like that
well, the windows box works fine network wise.
everything EXCEPT getting to the .99 linux box works.
I tihnk you're right and its windows firewall being retarded.
let's hope - from all you've said it sounds like windows software issue - the Firewall might just be doing it's job
could be.  I just added putty to the exceptions list though and I still don't connect. :/
I'd definitely just shut off the Windows Firewall entirely, and see if it works
Yeah, trying that now.  Its still not working.
you can try the ubuntu live cd while you're at it
WAit, it works externally to ssh with putty.
